head.supplied: 7/6/90. ¶ ¶ I thank you, dear Mr Macdonald, for following up Mr Lindts proposition. ¶ I did not like to be disobliging to him, as he is not only a member of our Society, but also as ¶ he ¶ support...

div.p: A38 Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (Victorian Branch) records, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

I thank you, dear Mr Macdonald, for following up Mr Lindts proposition.
See M to A. Macdonald, 5 June 1890. I did not like to be disobliging to him, as he is not only a member of our Society, but also as he supported several of our meetings by a splendid display of photograms. The idea of getting help from us arose entirely with him . I look more to the photographic results than any other of this exploit. We could only deal with him; thus I do not like to enter into communications with the Rev. Mr Fison. We have a good anthropologic correspondent in the Rev. Mr M'Donald in the New Hebrides. Mr Wolff is however not
in the pay of any Society ; he simply is a delegate of the Leipzig anthropol. Society,
Verein für Anthropologie, Leipzig? which merely means that he is to interest himself, to advance abroad the interests of that institution.
